DOC.HEAD: Vatican Appoints Coadjutor in Dallas, New Auxiliary in California
DOC.TEXT: Pope John Paul II on Tuesday appointed a coadjutor bishop for Dallas and a new auxiliary bishop for the diocese in Orange County, Calif. The pope appointed Monsignor Charles Victor Grahmann, currently the bishop in Victoria, Texas, as the coadjutor in Dallas. Grahmann, 58, is a native of Hallettsville, Texas. He was ordained a priest in 1956 and consecrated a bishop on Aug. 20, 1981. The pope also named Monsignor Michael P. Driscoll, the current vicar general of the diocese in Orange County, Calif., as the new auxiliary bishop in that diocese. Driscoll, 50, a native of Long Beach, Calif., was ordained in Los Angeles in 1965. He has served as a parish priest in the diocese and later as the director of its social services.
